about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If you have a green light but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should:

about.name: If you have a green light but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you have a green light but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should: | If you have a green light but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Even if your traffic light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.

comment.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.

suggestedAnswer.text: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.

comment.text: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.

suggestedAnswer.text: Merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.

comment.text: Merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.

comment.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.

answerExplanation.text: Even if your traffic light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

about.name: If you are being passed in a no passing zone, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you are being passed in a no passing zone, you should: | If you are being passed in a no passing zone, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Passing areas are based on how far ahead drivers can see. Allow the passing vehicle to re-enter the drive lane as easily as possible to help everyone avoid potential upcoming hazards.

comment.text: Pull off the road.
Maintain your speed and position.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.

comment.text: Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.

comment.text: Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.

answerExplanation.text: Passing areas are based on how far ahead drivers can see. Allow the passing vehicle to re-enter the drive lane as easily as possible to help everyone avoid potential upcoming hazards.

hasPart.name: What does this road sign indicate?

about.name: What does this road sign indicate?

hasPart.assesses: What does this road sign indicate? | What does this road sign indicate? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

comment.text: Directions for children
School zone ahead
Playground area ahead
School zone ahead

answerExplanation.text: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

comment.text: What does this road sign indicate? | Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

comment.text: No U-turn.

hasPart.name: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:

about.name: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:

hasPart.assesses: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a: | You may make a left turn on a red light only from a: - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

suggestedAnswer.text: One-way street onto a two-way street.

comment.text: One-way street onto a two-way street.

suggestedAnswer.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

comment.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

suggestedAnswer.text: Two-way street onto a one-way street.

comment.text: Two-way street onto a one-way street.

acceptedAnswer.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

comment.text: One-way street onto a one-way street.

answerExplanation.text: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

comment.text: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a: | You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

hasPart.name: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:

about.name: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should: | You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.

suggestedAnswer.text: Move to the left of the center lane.

comment.text: Move to the left of the center lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Signal before you arrive at the intersection.

comment.text: Signal before you arrive at the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.

comment.text: Turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.

acceptedAnswer.text: Signal before you arrive at the intersection.

comment.text: Signal before you arrive at the intersection.

answerExplanation.text: When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.

comment.text: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should: | When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.
